title: Solving ESP32 CAM communication errors (Try these in order)

fields.value: check if the correct COM port is selected.
check if the correct board is selected.
check if GPIO0 is shorted to GND, this puts the board in flash/"programming" mode.
try holding down the BOOT/FLASH button while uploading your sketch.
check if there are any wiring errors or loose connections (note that ESP32 CAM and FTDI TX and RX pins must be cross connected (TX goes to RX)).
try powering the board with 5V through the 5V pin instead of 3.3V.

fields.name: still not fixed?
fields.value: check out this [Troubleshooting Guide](https://randomnerdtutorials.com/esp32-cam-troubleshooting-guide/#:~:text=If%20you%20get%20this%20exact,times%2C%20might%20solve%20the%20issue.). if the issue is ***still*** not fixed, your ESP32 CAM or FTDI board may be broken.
